Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: SHOW TYPE: This table identifies the appearance of the hydrocarbons in the objectbeing evaluated. For example, show types can include Asphaltic stain, Bleeding gas,Oil fluorescence.
Column Comment.3: SHOW OBSERVATION NUMBER: The unique observation number for each showtype recorded in the well. (Ordered by formation/interval.)
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the bottom of the show interval.
Column Comment.6: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: LITHOLOGIC DESCRIPTION: Description of the lithology associated with thehydrocarbon show (e.g., color, grain size, mineralogical composition, etc.).
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: RESERVOIR INDICATOR: Yes/No flag indicating if the show is in the reservoirsection of the well. Important to identify the main pay zones in wells and hence theareal distribution where that stratigraphic unit has pay. A subset of the distribution ofthe reservoir stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.14: SAMPLE TYPE: The type of sample that is described. For example, a cutting.
Column Comment.15: SHOW SYMBOL: Code for the symbol depicting the type of hydrocarbon show.
Column Comment.16: The document that was the source of the information for this row. For examplegovernment and regulatory agency forms, operator reports or scout tickets.
Column Comment.17: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.18: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the show interval.
Column Comment.19: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
